alert.note: Alert for Fountain; Parke; Vermillion; Warren (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 24 at 9:11PM EST until March 04 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in Indiana... Wabash River. .Multiple rounds of recent rainfall preceded by snow melt, along with the current system moving through with wintry precipitation, will keep minor flooding ongoing along the East Fork White, upper White and most of the Upper Wabash. Lower portions of the White and Wabash are expected to see moderate flooding, where rain of up to an inch fell during the daytime hours Thursday. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY, MARCH 04... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Covington. * WHEN...Until Friday, March 04. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Flood water is at critical height for most agricultural levees. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EST Thursday the stage was 22.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM EST Thursday was 22.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning to 15.5 feet and then begin rising Thursday morning. It will then rise again to 16.0 feet Friday, March 04. It will fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Friday morning by around 1115 AM EST.
